page.title: 05Transport (Rail)
page.content:
Rail Transport
Sleights is on the Whitby to Middlesborough line. It is served by 14 trains, seven each way every day from Monday to Saturday. During summer, there are 4 trains each way on Sundays. There are no Sunday sevices from September to May. The line is of little importance to the national rail network, it being one of the country's few surviving branch lines. It is single tracked and operated by diesel multiple units for the passengers, there being no freight service. Although the people of the area use it relatively little, it is used to carry most of the secondary school children into Whitby and back, morning and evening, serving Eskdale and Whitby Comprehensive schools.
